page.title: 09HARRIS QUARRIES
page.content: { { }Above Ulley Reservoir in the hillsides you will find an out-crop of red sandstone.This is the last working quarry in this area.Originally twenty five quarries extracted stone around this area. Three men are employed to remove and work the stone.Much of the stone is used in the local building trade and therefore has to be blasted out with great care to preserve the regular square shape for cutting into bricks.The rough cut stone is then used for making crazy paving or for facing fire places.The stone is prepared on a large diamond cut wheel. Resourses for a further twenty five years work remain in the quarry.This and the marble imported from Spain, Portugal and Italy and slate from Cornwall and China will be used for fire places and garden ornaments.
